item.description:
A reading, and if desired, we are of course in Chinatown and could grab a snack or early dinner somewhere nearby.

This story looks fascinating to me - hope you can come!

*SUGGESTED YOU RSVP TO BCNC IF YOU CAN GO AND ARE INTERESTED - THANKS!
RSVP to info@bcnc.net or call 617-635-5129.
***************
Sponsored by BCNC and Friends of Madame White Snake.

Free admission. A post-reading reception will follow.[/color]

Join us Saturday, May 30th, 3 - 5 pm at BCNC, 38 Ash Street and meet librettist Cerise Lim Jacobs and guest readers: Larrayne Dina Chu, Dr. William Hsu (Joslin Diabetes Center), Leverett Wing, & Janet Wu (WCVB NewsCenter 5).
***************
Madame White Snake tells the story of a powerful white snake demon who transforms into a beautiful woman to experience love. She meets her true love, Xu Xian, at the Broken Bridge on the West Lake in Hangzhou, and marries him.

An Abbot sees through her human form to the snake and considers the relationship a violation of all of the traditional taboos of race and religion, the divine and the profane. He decides to intervene and not surprisingly, disaster strikes......
